comments.body: maybe instead of adding an extra slot, you can simply use amethyst instead of lapis, and when using amethyst you get higher level enchantments, similar to how gold equipment gets better enchantments than other materials. This way you have a really good incentive for finding the amethyst geodes to farm, because they are really good at improving your enchantments before you have access to enchanted books

yes! as crystals are offend use in magic, I was thinking using the smiting table to combine the shard with weapons, armor, and tools so when enchanting, it will act like gold tools and give better enchantments.

I was thinking about using shards as an easier way to upgrade enchantment books.

For example: Combining Efficiency II with a shard in an anvil to create Efficiency III with the cost of a few levels.

Maybe if you get lucky the shard will also add an additional enchantment to the book also.

Amethyst uses:  Scrying.

A "scrying eye"....craft the eye with amethyst around an Ender Eye....Then craft a "Scrying table"....much like an enchanting table but uses amethyst instead of diamonds....   once the table is crafted, the eye is "bound" to the table much like compasses are to lodestones, and then the eye can be placed.   Once place, the eye can be "seen thru" using the table, showing the current area around the eye......

A given table might only "connect" to a limited number of scrying eyes, perhaps as many as 3.....

I was just having the same thought, could even do a new enchantment table for powering up enchantments perhaps tie it in with something new from the end to encourage a late-game purpose. Could even be the foundation for late-game automation that a lot of mods add for farming instead of making villagers do the work and taking from them serf style. Or large complex redstone machines with tnt for cobblestone and lumber...

The new echoshards could maybe used instead of amethyst and give may not better, but other enchantments, that may are harder to handel but strong when mastered.

I'd like to see more edible and non-edible plants because there has been expansions on almost everything else. I'd love to see both common, cultivated plants like pears and plums and wild edibles like wild strawberries and nettles. Nettles would sting, and need to be treated before consumption. And yes, dandelions and roses are actually edible. Dandelions are better the younger the leaf, else the white un-tasty juice will spoil the flavour. 

Some edibles that grow on trees: pear, orange, plum, peach, cherry, date, almond, chestnut, walnut, hazel, banana, lemon, lime, pomegranate, cashew, papaya, nectarine, apricot, avocado, coconut, kiwifruit, passion fruit, mango just for starters. We can't have this many trees, that much is clear. But we could make a stem called "fruit tree" or something, and if we plant an avocado stone in a fruit tree stub, that tree will bear avocados. 

The spice cinnamon would be obtained from stripping certain trees' bark, and tree sap must be tapped from certain trees. Certain trees would mean a tree bearing a specific fruit. The fruit must therefore be visible.

Some can be eaten right away, and some needs to be prepared. We could make smoothies, cranberry biscuits, mixed salads and so much more. I'd also like to see herbs that can be used for tea, toddy and coffee (and a recipie for hot chocolate please), which would make you quicker while in snowy areas. I mean, putting leaves in a bucket of water is something a no-brainer in the wilderness could do. Lots of spices would also be cool, and could be used to make food give back the hears quicker. (Almost) like how cake has no delay. We could also make a chocolate cake with walnuts (egg, milk, cocoa, walnuts, sugar, wheat). 

Some decorative plants (sometimes usable for tea) are jasmine, bird cherry and common cherry (sakura). I'm not good with flowering trees, so somebody please add more to the list. To take decor flowers off trees, we could use the shears. 

For toxic plants, bella donna is the first that comes to mind. I hope a clever person will see this and add a list of toxic plants, berries, fruits, leaves and mushrooms!

I would love to see more giant mushrooms as well, both for aesthetics and building blocks. More decorative flowers would also be nice, but I don't feel like we are too lacking in these except for the naked lily pads. 

Thank you for reading!

Some would grow on bushes like the current berries, and herbs can be stripped for berries and then leaves. Only the berries would be replanted to grow a new bush. Bushes needs to take longer before they are ready again. 

More plants I'd love to see: peanut, blackberry, blackcurrant, redcurrant, strawberry, wild strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, cloud berry, cranberry, pineapple, watermelon, honey melon, cabbage, leek, red/yellow onion, garlic, brokkoli, cauliflower, cucumber, squash, eggplant, artichoke, brussel sprouts, asparagus, different types of beans, celery, fennel, spinach, nettles, bell pepper, chili pepper, rhubarb, corn, tomatoes, dragon fruit, durian, fig, goji, guava, olive, cantaloupe, white currant, rice, edible more mushrooms, etc.

Some plants, like rhubarb, can be harvested twice. After 1 time it shrinks, and after 2 it is gone. If you only harvest once, it will regrow over time. Rice would have to be planted in a slot of water surrounded by soil on 4 sides. Some mushrooms will grow on the ground (forest's gold) and some on the trees (usually white or brown).

There could be more vegetables like Brussels sprouts, kale, or tomatoes. There could also be fruit trees like avocados, bananas, and peaches. For non-edible plants there should be poisonous mushrooms.

Some temperate edibles to possibly add: mulberry trees, wild garlic/onion (could simply make the existing allium item edible), raspberries/blackberries, grapes, thistles/nettles, rhubarb, maple syrup, morels, walnuts, hazelnuts, mint, gooseberries.

Nuts Update: Chestnuts, Walnuts, Hazelnuts, Acorns and Squirrels

These new trees would add a much needed variety to the forest of the overworld, chestnuts would give spike balls that could be thrown causing some damage, or opened to get chestnuts and eat them raw or cooked, or golden chestnuts using nuggets.

Hazelnut trees would work similar to bamboo but in a brown color, and becoming thicker overtime, giving hazelnuts, bows made from their wood would be stronger.

Wallnuts you would get the possibility of eating them raw, roasted or golden wallnuts using gold nuggets.

Acorns would be turned onto flour for new bakery recipes, or fed to pigs and that would increase their reproduction rate.

Finally squirrels would be small and go around forests burying their nuts into a new dirt block called squirrel stash that would release the turn inside when dug up, squirrels would be tamed giving them nuts, and would sit on the players shoulder once tamed like a parrot.

Instead of it being a new block of farmland, why not just have it be regular mycelium blocks we already have? Crops also grow faster in rows next to one another so just have saplings next to mycelium receive a boosted growth rate like crops do in rows, that way they don't have to add an entirely new block type.
I like the idea of them being toggleable instead, as some people like them the way they are. Perhaps with a rightclick you could toggle their two states.
I like this Idea because then if you were going to bed then you could turn the lantern off so that itâ€™s dark

I would love to be able to toggle lanterns. I build in creative, with the mobSpawning gamerule set to false. I build cities and towns with the help of MCEdit and Amulet Editor. I also use the ever useful debug tool to get details right. Lanterns would be an immensely helpful detail for houses and offices. Smaller interiors of these buildings cannot afford to use redstone lighting. In larger buildings like theatres and schools, I can hide the redstone wiring in the structure, or I can use the debug stick to turn the lights on. At the moment lanterns are an unrealistic detail to add to my small interiors without the ability to turn them off.

One problem in survival with toggling a lantern is the light source is being turned off, opening the area up to mob spawning. It would not be practical to have unlit areas in survival.

Once again, I really want this to be a feature. I would not be a fan of the lantern being powered by redstone signal, however, as having a lever next to the lantern, or redstone dust trailing away from it would be messy. I want to be able to right click the lantern to turn it on or off. It would be consistent with the real life behavior of lanterns, as you can turn them on and off in real life. This would give the lantern more value and set it apart from the rest of the light sources--torches and glowstone can't be toggled, redstone lamps can be with redstone signal, and lanterns can be with a right click.

I think lanterns should be toggleable and light up in your hand. Although, this would get annoying when building. Therefore, it would be by default deactivated and in 2D item form. When it is used, it will turn into a 3D model and light up your surroundings. It might be useful for adventuring in the dark without leaving a trail of torches wherever you go.

This would be a great idea, however, I think the reason for this is that sometimes we are so filled up with space for a larger resource hunt that we get bogged down.  My purpose for using this would be to be able to have a partner be able to take things out when your inventory gets too full.    In order to make sure that this does not make the players OP, I think at least one of the following needs to be incorporated:

A) The player's inventory has to be full in order to place something in the "public" Ender Chest.

B) Groups should be made for the "public" Ender Chest, similar to how only one person can currently access the contents of his or her own Ender Chest, a group of 2 or 3 (hence the Partner example) should only be able to access the contents of its "public" Ender Chest.

C) The player has to place a hopper/chest input system at the same time that another player places a hopper/chest output system, so that the contents that are meaning to be shared/transferred slide right through- This supports the "partner" concept.  

B and C are most logical to me.
yes me and my dad play minecraft togeather and a ender chest seems pointless to us bc if we store items in it and 1 of us is out mining while the other is building we cant get to said item S:
The nametag idea is clever! Like set a specific name for the chests between you and your friend!

The "group" idea is interesting. It would be great to have like a "tiny enderchest", something that has to be placed, or opened in the player's inventory like a backback.

Each player would have a personal "tiny enderchest" (like the normal enderchest) which would have something like 4 slots of capacity. However, they could invite another player to "mix" their "tiny enderchests". As a result, these two players would have a common 8-slot "tiny enderchest", and could share items through it.

We could imagine an "invite and accept" feature in the "tiny enderchest" gui, and players could mix their "tiny enderchests" up to a certain amount of players.

We could be able to craft this item with something found in the new 1.16 warped forest biome in nether, and something quite expensive like an ender eye, an ender crystal or a nether star.

This could be done through teams
There would be an option in /team modify for a shared enderchest
Alternatively, if you were in a team you could have 9 slots at the bottom of your enderchest which were always shared to your team, and the normal 27 slots of private enderchest space
I had an idea that the game recognizes who places ender chests down, and if double ender chests are added and two players make one double ender chest, they could both interact with it

The chest should be made from crying obsidian. This would give it a different appearance and it gives a reason it works differently.
This would be great for servers even useful for single player worlds because it would be a second type of ender chest for those players.

Instead of an open access ender chest, I appreciate having a means of storing items I do not want just anyone gaining access to, how about a coded ender chest, like a safe/lock box. In a realm I play on random coordinates are given to the members to start their base at. Sometimes we have need of a resource and another player might have it and have to trek thousands of blocks just to deliver resources, and then thousands of blocks back... iced nether tunnels have reduced the travel time, but it would be nice if we could place an item in our end chest, and the other player put the combination/code into an ender chest on their side and receive the items they needed... then having the ability to change the codes periodically would help keep things secure. I would like to see this as an addition to what is already in the game instead of replace it...
I'd make it only a few slots eg... 8?

the concept of long distance item sharing is definitely a needed addition to the game. The only thing needed is that an ender chest act like a compass. A compass links to a loadstone and receives a enchanted glint to show it is different. So an ender chest should be able to link to a single normal chest which then allows both to share items and both to receive a enchanted glint to set them apart from other chests.

If you are foreseeing having linked chests becomes a headache to gameplay simply only let each player have one at a time.

Armour stands already have arms, but they can only be obtained with commands on the PC Java Edition (that I know of.) However it would be very nice if there was a method or way to add arms to armor stands in survival. Maybe right click an armor stand without arms with 2 sticks, or have a crafting recipe involving the armor stand with 2 sticks to add arms to it, which would produce a new item (armor stand w/ arms.)

Below is a picture of armor stands with and without arms, to get one WITH arms, you can use this command:

/summon minecraft:armor_stand ~ ~ ~ {ShowArms:true}

The ore could be called, Mineconite.  A new ore that is spesific to minecraft.

I truly love the idea of an ore that lures the warden to your location and really sets the uneasiness and urgency the resource gives off. but personally I think it should of a different use, maybe it could a variant to netherite instead of a direct upgrade, sort of like a class system. ex. netherite is more of a strength, damage and up close based class but "skulkium" (as you put it, great name btw) could be more a ranged/assassin esc class. maybe it could give a damage boost to bows/crossbows and for melee weapons you could get double damage for attacking an enemy from behind or something.

This is a very interesting idea, I love to idea of having a greater risk to mining. But, I have two small problems with this I idea. (DISCLAIMER: This should be a mod but if you have any other ideas for different features, this is to help create a more "Minecrafty" and balanced feature). The ore would have to be spawned exposed to air in the Deep Dark biome. Reason why, if you were mining for the said ore using a technique like strip mining. The risk factor the ore is mean't to present is defeated, as the Warden wouldn't be able to attack you in the small passage way (As of the known features of The Warden during the making of this comment). Second of all, the idea of the Eternal enchantment is amazing, the idea is balanced, as the enchantment would keep your armor (Or Weapons and Tools) from loosing durability for a period of time. But instead of it being something that could be enchanted from an enchantment table it should be found only in Deep Dark Cities, it would match the property of something to try and be everlasting, as how the Cities and Warden seem to have been around for quite some time. That is all I have to say

It would also be great if the new ore was used like netherite. Instead of crafting directly with it, there could be steps to it. Then you could combine it with diamond armer and tools. It would give the tools and armer different properties from netherite. At the same time it would be on the same level as netherite. This would make it so that netherite does not become pointless after the new ore comes out. I see it as being an option, â€œshould I wear my netherite, or my deep dark armor?â€
i really hope this makes it in the final product once the update is released!

I think it should be like a polished variant. More expensive, but doesn't turn green over time.
They could add tin and when mixed with copper, it would make bronze,which doesn't oxidate easily.

Maybe you could stop the aging of the copper by rightclicking it with a slimeball (i.e. coating it). This would allow the player to preserve every age of copper they enjoy. Additionally magmaslime could be used to greatly accelerate the oxidation process.

Similarly, In different dimensions -- and possibly even biomes -- the speed of oxidation could change. 

 

In the End, I always thought it would have no atmosphere like it was a cluster of space debris, so it would be a cool mechanic if the oxidization process didn't occur in the dimension.
Copper could only oxidize during rain, which keeps it orange in rain-free biomes. Or copper just doesn't oxidize in those biomes regardless, desert, badlands, etc.
I think copper should stay orange when placed in the Nether

You could add berry juice or acid made from the new glow berries (sweet berries donâ€™t seem like they would be acidic to me) and a bottle in a crafting table, similar to mushroom stew. You could use this On a copper block to prevent it from aging, kind of like how lemon juice prevents apples from turning brown irl. Alternatively, you could use it to clean the tarnish off, turning it back into the orange variant.

I thought the same and I have an idea as to how we can do it.

We have honeycomb (beeswax). We can take the copper block, put it in with the honeycomb in a crafting table, and get a version with wax on it that would not turn green.

I also believe that if possible, we should be able to collect the copper blocks at the level of oxidization they have reached at that time. However, I do not know if this is possible.

Thanks.
